builder.name: Jar
builder.summary:
Builds a Java archive (.jar) file from a source tree of .class files. If the &cv-JARCHDIR; value is set, the &jar; command will change to the specified directory using the -C option. If the contents any of the source files begin with the string Manifest-Version, the file is assumed to be a manifest and is passed to the &jar; command with the m option set.
env.Jar(target = 'foo.jar', source = 'classes')

cvar.name: JARCHDIR
cvar.summary: The directory to which the Java archive tool should change (using the -C option).

cvar.name: JARCOM
cvar.summary: The command line used to call the Java archive tool.

cvar.name: JARCOMSTR
cvar.summary:
The string displayed when the Java archive tool is called If this is not set, then &cv-JARCOM; (the command line) is displayed.
env = Environment(JARCOMSTR = "JARchiving $SOURCES into $TARGET")

cvar.name: JARFLAGS
cvar.summary: General options passed to the Java archive tool. By default this is set to cf to create the necessary jar file.

cvar.name: JARSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix for Java archives: .jar by default.
